meanings.sent1: She gave a haughty look to anyone who dared to question her authority.
meanings.sent2: The queen's haughty demeanor made it clear she considered herself above everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The haughty cat refused to acknowledge the presence of the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: Her haughty attitude was like a barrier that kept others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The haughty eagle soared high above, looking down on the world below with contempt.

meanings.sent1: His haughty behavior made it difficult for others to approach him.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's haughty attitude alienated many of the employees.
meanings.sent3: The haughty peacock strutted around as if it owned the entire garden.
meanings.sent4: The haughty mountain stood tall, looking down on the valleys below.
meanings.sent5: Her haughty gaze seemed to declare her superiority over everyone else in the room.

meanings.sent1: The haughty socialite refused to speak to anyone she deemed beneath her.
meanings.sent2: His haughty tone made it clear he thought very little of those around him.
meanings.sent3: The haughty waiter sneered at the customers who didn't order the most expensive dish.
meanings.sent4: Her haughty laughter echoed through the room, making others feel small.
meanings.sent5: The haughty professor looked down on his students, believing himself to be intellectually superior.
